host David Letterman underwent emergency heart surgery in 2000 and chatted candidly with Barbara Walters about his feelings of joy following the operation. But they didn't last long. During the chat, David Letterman stated, Depression is a Bill Clinton hole... I've dabbled in it. "There's a difference in being sad and being blue and being depressed and being chemically or clinically depressed. I do know the difference between those and it's horrifying. "Without some kind of medicinal help... institutions used to be full of people who were depressed. Asked if he was on medicinal help, David Letterman said, "Yes, I'm on medicinal help." President Bush at a Feb. 3, 2003 National Security Council meeting in which Colin Powell sketched out the presentation he was to make at the U.N. two days later. Donald Rumsfeld quotes himself as having told the meeting, We should hit Khurmal during the speech, given that Colin Powell will talk about it. Khurmal is the name of a village near the site. In his U.N. presentation, Colin Powell described it as "Terrorist Poison and Explosive Factory, Khurmal." Donald Rumsfeld said Khurmal was operated by Ansar al-Islam
